db:abstract.db:para: Provides QML types for mapping and location information.

db:section.db:title: Overview
db:section.db:para: Provided that a position has been obtained, this module can add a Map with Places of Interest (POI) and Places. The user can be made aware of nearby features and related information, displayed graphically. Features on the Map can be places of business, entertainment, and so on. They may include paths, roads, or forms of transport, enabling navigation optimization and assistance.

To perform navigation we need Routes from start to destination. These routes are made up of segments, where each RouteSegment can be considered a navigation subtask: drive 100 meters, turn left. The beginning and end of each segment is a waypoint, that is, one part of our journey.

A typical use case for the API is a user looking for a particular type of place, say a restaurant. The user could enter a search string into the map application and respond to a list or display of results for restaurants "near" the device. The application could then be used to navigate to the restaurant using an optimized route that is aware of features in the environment that can help or hinder the journey. The navigation then proceeds with the user's progress monitored by means of the current Location. In the context of this API the map application would be aware of the location and size of various places and the location of the user. Plugins would supply the data required by the application to determine routes and navigation instructions. The Place types would hold information about the destination and surrounding objects including displayable representations. The Map type would enable this information to be displayed, panned, zoomed and so on. The Route would be determined by a plugin with each RouteSegment holding the navigation instructions guided by the updated current Location.

Plugins are a means of specifying which location-based service to use. For example, a plugin may allow connection to a provider's service that provides geocoding and routing information, which can be consumed by the application. There may be various GeoServices plugins for various tasks with some plugins providing more than one service. One QML Plugin must be created for each required GeoService plugin. Plugins are required for maps, routing and geocoding, and places, however the default plugin handles all four of these services. A plugin may require online access or may support on-board maps and data.

db:note.db:para: Plugins may not provide features such as paging or relevance hints.

db:section.db:para: The following links provide more detailed information about maps and places:

db:td.db:para: Searching for and managing points of interest.

db:listitem.db:para: The Plugin type describes a Location based services plugin.
The PluginParameter type describes a parameter to a Plugin.
The Map type displays a map.
The MapCircle type displays a geographic circle on a Map.
The MapGestureArea type provides Map gesture interaction.
The MapItemView is used to populate Map from a model.
MapPinchEvent type provides basic information about pinch event.
The MapPolygon type displays a polygon on a Map
The MapPolyline type displays a polyline on a map.
The MapQuickItem type displays an arbitrary Qt Quick object on a Map.
The MapRectangle type displays a rectangle on a Map.
The MapRoute type displays a Route on a Map.
The MapType type holds information about a map type.
The Route type represents one geographical route.
The RouteManeuver type represents the information relevant to the point at which two RouteSegments meet.
The RouteModel type provides access to routes.
The RouteQuery type is used to provide query parameters to a RouteModel.
The RouteSegment type represents a segment of a Route.
The GeocodeModel type provides support for searching operations related to geographic information.
The Category type represents a category that a Place can be associated with.
The CategoryModel type provides a model of the categories supported by a Plugin.
The ContactDetail type holds a contact detail such as a phone number or a website address.
The ContactDetails type holds contact details for a Place.
The EditorialModel type provides a model of place editorials.
The ExtendedAttributes type holds additional data about a Place.
The Icon type represents an icon image source which can have multiple sizes.
The ImageModel type provides a model of place images.
The Place type represents a location that is a position of interest.
The PlaceAttribute type holds generic place attribute information.
Provides access to place search results.
Provides access to search term suggestions.
The Ratings type holds place rating information.
Provides access to reviews of a Place.
Holds data regarding the supplier of a place, a place's image, review, or editorial.
The User type identifies a user who contributed a particular Place content item.

db:section.db:title: Alphabetical Listing of All QML Types

db:listitem.db:para: The Category type represents a category that a Place can be associated with.
The CategoryModel type provides a model of the categories supported by a Plugin.
The ContactDetail type holds a contact detail such as a phone number or a website address.
The ContactDetails type holds contact details for a Place.
The EditorialModel type provides a model of place editorials.
The ExtendedAttributes type holds additional data about a Place.
The GeocodeModel type provides support for searching operations related to geographic information.
The Icon type represents an icon image source which can have multiple sizes.
The ImageModel type provides a model of place images.
The Map type displays a map.
The MapCircle type displays a geographic circle on a Map.
The MapGestureArea type provides Map gesture interaction.
The MapItemView is used to populate Map from a model.
MapPinchEvent type provides basic information about pinch event.
The MapPolygon type displays a polygon on a Map
The MapPolyline type displays a polyline on a map.
The MapQuickItem type displays an arbitrary Qt Quick object on a Map.
The MapRectangle type displays a rectangle on a Map.
The MapRoute type displays a Route on a Map.
The MapType type holds information about a map type.
The Place type represents a location that is a position of interest.
The PlaceAttribute type holds generic place attribute information.
Provides access to place search results.
Provides access to search term suggestions.
The Plugin type describes a Location based services plugin.
The PluginParameter type describes a parameter to a Plugin.
The Ratings type holds place rating information.
Provides access to reviews of a Place.
The Route type represents one geographical route.
The RouteManeuver type represents the information relevant to the point at which two RouteSegments meet.
The RouteModel type provides access to routes.
The RouteQuery type is used to provide query parameters to a RouteModel.
The RouteSegment type represents a segment of a Route.
Holds data regarding the supplier of a place, a place's image, review, or editorial.
The User type identifies a user who contributed a particular Place content item.
